Class ViewData

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.model.game.data.ViewData
public final class ViewData extends Object
Encapsulates data for rendering. Contains the falling brick's position, shape, and the next shape preview.

  • Constructor Summary

    Description
    ViewData(int[][] brickData, int xPosition, int yPosition, int[][] nextBrickData, boolean isProp)
    Constructs a ViewData object.

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewData

      public ViewData(int[][] brickData, int xPosition, int yPosition, int[][] nextBrickData, boolean isProp)
      Constructs a ViewData object.
      Parameters:
      brickData - the matrix that represents the shape of the current brick
      xPosition - the column index of the falling brick on the game board
      yPosition - the row index of the falling brick on the game board
      nextBrickData - the matrix that represents the shape of the next brick

  • Method Details

    • getBrickData

      public int[][] getBrickData()
      Gets the shape matrix of the currently falling brick. A copy is returned to prevent external modification of the internal data.
      Returns:
      a deep copy of the matrix that represents the brick's shape

    • getxPosition

      public int getxPosition()
      Gets the x position of the currently falling brick.
      Returns:
      the column index where the brick is located

    • getyPosition

      public int getyPosition()
      Gets the y position of the currently falling brick.
      Returns:
      the row index where the brick is located

    • getNextBrickData

      public int[][] getNextBrickData()
      Gets the shape matrix of the next brick to fall.
      Returns:
      a deep copy of the matrix that represents the next brick's shape

    • isProp

      public boolean isProp()
      Checks whether the current falling brick is prop brick or not.
      Returns:
      true if it is prop brick, else false
